oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Letter from Corporal Lorenzo Dow Atwood to his wife Cordelia
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: In this letter, Corporal Lorenzo Dow Atwood, Co. D, 43rd Wisc. Infantry Regiment, USA describes the route his regiment took from Camp Washburn to Tennessee. He mentions guerrillas in the area between Louisville, Ky and Nashville, Tennessee and that they shall travel with guns loaded. He also decribes "some five hundred rebel prisoners" who came into a camp near Louisville, KY for safe-keeping. Atwood was part of the Union garrison at Johnsonville, Tenn. and was present for the attack on Nov. 4, 1864.
